page.title: 16BUILDINGS,KNOTTINGLEY AREA
page.content: { Listed buildings}in the Knottingley area:St.Andrew's Church,Ferrybridge, The Toll House & Old A1 Bridge,Ferry- bridge;St.Botolph's Church,Chapel St., Knottingley & Georgian houses nearby. There are 6275 homes.Wakefield Council stock is :191 bungalows,2109 houses, 753 low rise flats ,26 maisonettes & 34 homes in the only{high rise block (9 storeys) which is surprisingly popular.Since 1978,383 Council & 658 private homes built.Council stock has fallen because of{sales}to tenants.The {least popular}council estate is the {vandal-hit}Warwick Estate,built in the 60s for men at the new Kellingley pit.Despite its age and poor heating, Springfields seems the{most popular}. In Brotherton & Byram most houses are private,except for a small council estate(Selby District Council). Homes at Byram are a little more{exclusive}.
